source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第五十一
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 51

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏闍那崛多譯
translation: Sui Tianzhu Tripiṭaka Jñānagupta Translation

source_sentence: ◎尸棄本生品下
translation: Śikhin's Account of the Past Lives

source_sentence: 「爾時，鹿王遙見獵師執杖而來，即便以偈告牝鹿言：「『此是獵師將來至，　　身體烏黑著鹿衣，　　今來必剝我皮膚，　　斬截支節而將去。』
translation: "It was then that the deer king saw the hunter coming with his staff from a distance, and he addressed the female deer in verse, saying, 'This is the hunter coming, his body is black and he's wearing a deer robe, and he's going to strip me of my skin and cut off my limbs as he goes.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，牝鹿遙迎獵者，漸至其前，而說偈言：「『善哉汝獵師，　　今可敷草鋪，　　先破我皮肉，　　爾乃殺鹿王。』
translation: "The female deer then greeted the hunter at a distance and gradually approached him, saying, "Good, you hunter! Now, you can spread out your straw bedding and first break my skin and flesh, and then you'll kill the deer king."

source_sentence: 「爾時，獵師問於牝鹿作如是言：『今此鹿王，與汝何親？』
translation: "It was then that the hunter asked the female deer, 'What is this deer king close to you?'

source_sentence: 是時牝鹿報獵師言：『此是我夫，甚相愛敬，以是因緣，作如是念：「願不與彼愛別分離。」
translation: The female deer then reported to the hunter, saying, 'This is my husband, whom I really like and respect, and because of this reason, I had this thought, 'May I not be separated from that person's craving.'

source_sentence: 以是義故，必先殺我，後及鹿王。』
translation: For this reason, he will surely kill me first and then the deer king.'

source_sentence: 爾時，獵師作如是念：『此是仁婦，希有希有！
translation: The hunter then had this thought, 'This is a kind woman, rare and valuable!'

source_sentence: 是鹿能作如是大事。』
translation: This deer is capable of doing such a great deed.'

source_sentence: 時彼獵師，於其牝鹿，生大歡喜，即以偈頌，報牝鹿言：「『我自生小未曾聞，　　見有諸獸解人語，　　此事世間甚希有，　　我意何忍起害心。
translation: That hunter then rejoiced greatly over the deer and reported to the deer in verse, saying, 'I've never heard of such a thing since I was a child, but I've seen animals that understand human speech.

source_sentence: 今既不殺於汝身，　　亦復并放爾夫去，　　如是全活爾身命，　　願汝夫婦恒相隨。』
translation: Now, since I won't kill you, I'll also let you go with your golf ball; thus, I'll let you live, and may your husband and wife always be with you.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，獵師詣彼弶所解放鹿王。
translation: "It was then that the hunter went to that snare and freed the deer king.

source_sentence: 爾時牝鹿見王免縛，心大歡喜，遍體踊躍，不能自勝。
translation: Seeing the king freed from bondage, the female deer was overjoyed and leaped with joy throughout her body, unable to control herself.

source_sentence: 復以偈句，白獵師言：「『善哉如是大獵師，　　諸親見者皆歡喜，　　如我得見夫免脫，　　歡喜踊躍亦復然。』」
translation: Again, he spoke in verse to the hunter, saying, 'Good, such is the great hunter, whose intimate visitors are delighted, just as I was delighted to see my husband freed, and I likewise am elated and jump with joy.'"

source_sentence: 佛告優陀夷：「汝今當知！
translation: The Buddha told Udāyin, "Now, you should know!

source_sentence: 彼鹿王者，豈異人乎？
translation: Is that deer king someone else?

source_sentence: 即我身是；時牝鹿者，耶輸陀羅即其是也。
translation: That's who I am, and that's who the female deer was at the time, Yaśodharā.

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅於彼之時，尚隨順我受大苦厄，況於今日，能隨順我，行大苦行，於諸世人莫能行事而能行也。」
translation: At the time, Yaśodharā was still subject to great suffering and distress because he followed me, so why would he be able to follow me and perform great acts of suffering today that no one else in the world could do?"

source_sentence: 其羅睺羅，今以過業所逼惱故，在胎六年。
translation: Rāhula, now he's been in the womb for six years because he's been tormented by past actions.

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅，為是菩薩，懷愁毒故，不自嚴飾。
translation: Yaśodharā, this is a bodhisattva who doesn't adorn himself because of the sorrow and poison he bears.

source_sentence: 然其如來過六年後，證阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Still, after six years, that Tathāgata realized supreme perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 於時輸頭檀王所遣使人候消息者，彼等使人見佛世尊從坐起故，即詣輸頭檀王之所，到王所已，而白王言：「大王！
translation: When the king of Śuddhodana sent his messengers to await word, they saw the Bhagavān rising from his seat and went to the king of Śuddhodana, and when they arrived, they said to him, "Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，太子今者苦行已徹，稱滿心意，已從坐起。」
translation: You should know that the prince has completed his ascetic practices and has risen from his seat after fulfilling his intention."

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王聞此語已，別勅二人而告之曰：「汝等今當詣太子所，至彼處已，當宣我言，告彼太子：『汝於今者苦行已徹，當可速來統領國事，為轉輪王具足七寶。』」
translation: After hearing these words, King Śuddhodana sent a message to two people, telling them, "Now, you two must go to the prince, and when you get there, you must proclaim my words to the prince, 'Now that you've completed your ascetic practices, you can quickly take command of the country's affairs and complete the seven treasures for the wheel-turning king.'"

source_sentence: 時彼二人，奉王勅已，依王教命，如法頂受，承是勅意，詣太子所，頭面禮足，却住一面，白太子言：「善哉聖子！
translation: After they had received the king's order, they did as the king instructed, accepted it according to the teaching, complied with the order, went to the prince, bowed their heads and feet, withdrew to one side, and said to the prince, "Good, noble son!

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王，勅我二人，到聖子所，告聖子言：『汝於今者，苦行已徹，今可速來，承受我位，為轉輪王，七寶之具令悉備足。』」
translation: King Shutodana sent us both to the noble son and told him, 'Now that you've completed your ascetic practices, you can quickly come assume my position as wheel-turning king and be supplied with the full complement of the seven treasures.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊聞彼二人作是語已，而說偈言：「若人已調伏，　　世無不伏者，　諸佛境無邊，　　無跡無來去。
translation: After hearing these two people say this, the Bhagavān spoke in verse, saying, "If a person has been disciplined, there's no one in the world who isn't disciplined; the buddhas' realms are limitless, and there's no trace of them, no coming or going.

source_sentence: 若人不入網，　　愛無所從生，　諸佛境無邊，　　無跡無來去。」
translation: If a person doesn't enter a net, there's no desire that arises, the realm of the buddhas is limitless, and there's no trace of coming or going."

source_sentence: 爾時，耶輸陀羅於其宮內，聞是太子苦行已徹，猶望不久必應還來當受王位，政國治民，作轉輪王，便生是念：「太子若作轉輪聖王，我即當作第一妃后。」
translation: It was then that Yaśodharā was inside his palace when he heard that the prince had completed his ascetic practices and was hopeful that he would soon return to assume the position of king, govern his country and people, and become a wheel-turning king.

source_sentence: 如是念已，歡喜踊躍，遍滿其體，不能自勝。
translation: After thinking this, he rejoiced and jumped for joy, filling his body with joy, and he couldn't control himself.

source_sentence: 持種種香塗其身體，即著種種無價寶衣，及諸瓔珞而自莊飾，食諸妙饌，眠寢寶床，柔軟臥具，作如是事，豫待太子。
translation: He rubbed various kinds of incense on his body, dressed himself in various priceless jewelry and adorned himself with jewelry, ate wonderful foods, slept on a jeweled bed, and made soft and gentle bedding, and did all these things to prepare for the prince.

source_sentence: 時，羅睺羅過六年已，盡其往業，耶輸陀羅即以種種資物食飲，而自供養。
translation: After six years had passed, Rāhula exhausted his past activities, and then Yaśodharā offered himself up to him with various provisions to eat and drink.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，其羅睺羅，便即出生。
translation: As a result of this, Rāhula was born.

source_sentence: 既出生已，時諸內人尋共諮白輸頭檀王，作如是言：「異哉大王！
translation: After he was born, the inner circle then consulted King Śuddhodana and said, "It's extraordinary, Great King!

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅！
translation: Yaśodharā!

source_sentence: 今乃生子。」
translation: Now, a son has been born."

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王聞此事已，心大瞋怒，即作是言：「今我太子，捨家出家已經六歲，耶輸陀羅，今生此子，何從而得？」
translation: After hearing this, King Śuddhodana became furious and said, "Now, my prince, who left home and left home six years ago, how did he get this son born here, Yaśodharā?"

source_sentence: 是時釋子提婆達多，作如是言：「此是我子。」
translation: Then Devadatta, the son of Śākyamuni, said thus, "This is my son."

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王，倍增瞋恚，召諸釋種，悉令聚集，即告之曰：「卿等當知！
translation: King Śuddhodana became even more angry, summoned the Śākyas and gathered them together, and told them, "You should know!

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅，不護太子，亦不護我，不護諸釋，不惜名聞，縱恣其意，辱我宗族，我等今者應作何事而苦治也？」
translation: Yehuda, who doesn't protect the prince, doesn't protect me, doesn't protect the scholars, doesn't spare fame and reputation, and does as he pleases, insulting our clan, what should we do now to make things right?"

source_sentence: 爾時，釋種皆共同聲，作如是言：「耶輸陀羅！
translation: At that point, the Śākyas all spoke together, saying, "Yaśodharā!

source_sentence: 污辱家者，我等應當如辱家法而苦治之。」
translation: We will punish those who dishonor the family as we would dishonor the family and make them suffer."

source_sentence: 時彼眾內有一大臣，作如是言：「當髠其髮，以杖打之，打已印記。」
translation: Then there was a minister in that crowd who said, "He'll chop off his hair, beat it with a stick, and seal it after beating it."

source_sentence: 復有一臣，作如是言：「當截其耳，劓去其鼻。」
translation: Another minister said, "He will cut off his ear and wipe off his nose."

source_sentence: 復有一臣，而作是言：「當挑兩目。」
translation: Then there was a minister who said, 'Pick out your eyes.'

source_sentence: 復有一臣，作如是言：「槍貫木上。」
translation: Again, a minister said, 'Put a spear through wood.'

source_sentence: 復有一臣，作如是言：「擲著空井。」
translation: Another minister said, 'Throw it into an empty well.'

source_sentence: 復有一臣，作如是言：「擲著火內。」
translation: Another minister said, "Throw it into the fire!"

source_sentence: 復有一臣，作如是言：「令抱熾然大熱鐵柱。」
translation: Another minister did this, saying, "Make him carry a pillar of blazing-hot iron."

source_sentence: 復有一臣，作如是言：「繫縛手足，遣大群牛蹈而殺之。」
translation: Another minister said, "Bind his hands and feet, and send a huge herd of oxen to trample and kill him."

source_sentence: 復有一臣，作如是言：「令臥地上白象蹈之。」
translation: Then there was a minister who said, "Make a white elephant lying on the ground run over it."

source_sentence: 復有一臣，作如是言：「從頭至足，以鋸解之。」
translation: Another minister said, "From head to toe, use a saw to cut them down."

source_sentence: 復有一臣，作如是言：「節節支解分為八叚。」
translation: Another minister said, "Break it down section by section into eight coarse coarse coarse coarse coarse coarseness."

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王告諸臣言：「我今勅令耶輸陀羅及所生子，俱當就死。」
translation: It was then that King Śuddhodana addressed his ministers, "Now, I've commanded that Yaśodharā and the son he's given birth to should all die."

source_sentence: 是時如來已成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，便自觀見耶輸陀羅及所生子在厄難處，以慈悲心所逼惱故，處處顧視。
translation: Having achieved supreme perfect enlightenment, the Tathāgata then himself observed Yehotra and the son he'd given birth to in a place of trouble and looked around because he was being troubled by compassion.

source_sentence: 於時而有毘沙門天去佛不遠，時彼天王知如來意，即持筆墨及陀羅葉，往詣佛所。
translation: At the time, there was a Vaiśravaṇa god who wasn't far from the Buddha, and knowing the Tathāgata's intention, that god king took a writing pen and ink and a dhāraṇī leaf and went to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊手自作書，而白王言：「其所生兒，是我之息，願莫有疑。」
translation: The Bhagavān then wrote a book with his own hand and said to the king, "This is my child that was born, so please don't doubt it."

source_sentence: 爾時，毘沙門天王，從世尊所受是書已，尋即往至輸頭檀王大眾之內，即出其書王懷裏。
translation: After receiving this writing from the Bhagavān, the Vaiśravaṇa king then went to King Śuddhodana's large audience and took the writing out of the king's arms.

source_sentence: 爾時，彼書有證有驗，輸頭檀王見是驗已，思尋此書真是我息悉達太子，手自書處。
translation: After seeing that the book had been verified and validated, King Śuddhodana considered whether this book was really written by my hand, Prince Siddhârtha.

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王及諸大眾，為此因緣，於耶輸陀羅生歡喜心。
translation: For that reason, King Śuddhodana and the general public became delighted with Yaśodharā.

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅，傳聞人道大王有勅欲殺其身及所生子，護身命故，速疾往至摩訶波闍波提憍曇彌所，作如是言：「善哉尊后！
translation: When he heard that the humane king had ordered him to kill himself and the son he had given birth to, Yajaudra quickly went to Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī to protect his life and said, "Good, Your Highness!

source_sentence: 我無是過，此所生子，太子體胤，聽聞不久太子來到，若其到已，自應當知。
translation: I've done nothing wrong; this is the son I've given birth to, Prince Tinyin, and I've heard that the prince will soon arrive, and I should know if he has arrived.

source_sentence: 今欲殺我，是虛枉耳。」
translation: To want to kill me now would be a falsehood."

source_sentence: 爾時，摩訶波闍波提，聞耶輸陀羅作是語已，心復歡喜。
translation: After hearing this from Yaśodharā, Mahāprajāpatī was again encouraged.

source_sentence: 即遣使請輸頭檀王，至阿輸迦樹林之內，到林處已，而白王言：「唯願大王！
translation: He sent an envoy to invite King Śuddhodana to the grove of the Aśoka tree, and when he arrived there, he said to the king, "Please, Great King!

source_sentence: 當知，今者耶輸陀羅釋種之女，至於我邊，而作是言：『我無此過，我所生子，太子體胤，若彼太子，身來到已，自知虛實。』
translation: You should know that this woman of the Yaśodharā lineage came to me and said, 'There's nothing wrong with me; my son, the prince, is physically descended; if he were a prince, he'd know himself to be false after he arrives in the body.'

source_sentence: 是故大王！
translation: Therefore, Great King!

source_sentence: 莫作是事，應須待彼太子來到，即知此事定實云何。」
translation: Don't do that; you should wait until the prince arrives, and then you'll see how this is really determined."

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王聞彼摩訶波闍波提作如是等善利益義，即報之曰：「此言有理，若如尊后所言說者，我等宜住聽太子至；若不爾者，當知此事定實云何？」
translation: Hearing that Mahāprajāpatī had given such good advice, King Śuddhodana then reported, "That's reasonable talk; if it's as the venerable queen says, we should stay and listen to the prince's arrival; if not, then you should know how certain this matter is."

source_sentence: 雖復如此，輸頭檀王由於釋女耶輸陀羅未生歡喜，是故衣服及餘瓔珞，少分供給，發遣安置隨宜處所。
translation: Even so, King Śuddhodana didn't rejoice over Śākyamuni Yaśodharā, so he made a small offering of clothing and jewelry and sent her away to a suitable place.

source_sentence: 爾時，釋女耶輸陀羅，復至摩訶波闍波提憍曇彌所，至已白言：「善哉尊后！
translation: It was then that Śākyamuni Yaśodharā went back to Mahāprajāpatī Kauṇḍinya, and when she arrived, she said, "Good, Your Highness!

source_sentence: 我於今者，欲詣園內，酬昔所許諸天微願，暫一祠祀，未審尊后聽許已不？」
translation: Now, I'd like to go to the garden to grant the gods a minor vow I made in the past to temporarily perform a sacrifice.

source_sentence: 爾時，摩訶波闍波提，共彼釋女耶輸陀羅，將羅睺羅，廣辦供具，齎持雜物，詣彼神所。
translation: It was then that Mahāprajāpatī and that Śākyamuni woman Yajodharaputra brought Rāhula, who had prepared a large offering, to the god's place with sundry goods.

source_sentence: 其神名曰盧提羅迦，從神作名，其苑亦名盧提羅迦。
translation: The god's name was Rutilaka, and from the god's creation of the name, that garden was also called Rutilaka.

source_sentence: 於彼苑中，菩薩往昔在家之日，恒於彼苑按摩遊戲。
translation: In that garden, the bodhisattva used to spend his days at home massaging and playing in that garden.

source_sentence: 彼苑之內，有一大石，菩薩往日於上坐起。
translation: Inside that garden, there was a large rock on which the bodhisattva used to sit up.

source_sentence: 耶輸陀羅釋種之女，當於爾時，將羅睺羅，臥息彼石，於後捉石擲著水中，遂立誓言：「我今要誓，如實不虛，唯除太子，更無丈夫，共行彼此；我所生兒，實是太子體胤之息。
translation: At the time, the daughter of Yaśodharā, a member of the Śākya clan, took Rāhula and put him to rest on that rock, then grabbed the rock and threw it into the water and made a vow, "Now, I want to vow that this is true and not false, that there's no husband but the prince and that my child is really the prince's child, Tiyin's breath.

source_sentence: 是不虛者，令此大石在於水上浮遊不沒。」
translation: This is not false, and it will cause this boulder to float on the water and not sink."

source_sentence: 時彼大石，如彼要誓，在於水上遂即浮住，如芭蕉葉浮於水上，不沈不沒，亦復如是。
translation: That boulder then, just as he had promised, immediately floated on the water like a plantain leaf floating on water, not sinking or disappearing, and so it did.

source_sentence: 於時大眾，見聞此已，生希有心，讙譁嘯調，踊躍無已，叫喚跳躑，歌舞作倡，旋裾舞袖，又作種種音聲伎樂。
translation: When the people who saw and heard this gave rise to a feeling of hope, they clamored and shouted, jumped up and down, sang and danced, twirled their arms and turned their heads, and made all kinds of music and sounds.

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王聞此事時，歡喜踊躍，遍滿其體，不能自勝，即勅莊嚴彼迦毘羅婆蘇都城，令除荊棘沙礫土石、穢惡糞等諸不淨物，更以香湯，掃灑塗治，摩拭其地，在在處處，安置香鑪，燒最妙香。
translation: When King Śuddhodana heard about this, he was overcome with joy and excitement, and he commanded that the capital of Kapilavastu be adorned, so that thorns, sand, gravel, dirt, filth, and other impure things be removed, the ground be cleaned and coated with scented water, and a censer be placed in each place to burn the most wonderful incense.

source_sentence: 其香鑪間，雜錯種種妙色寶瓶，其寶瓶內，盛滿香水，於其水中，復安香花，於其香鑪寶瓶中間，更復安置芭蕉行列。
translation: Between the censer and the vajra, there are a variety of wonderfully colored jeweled vases filled with perfume, and in the water there are scented flowers, and in the middle of the censer and the vajra there are rows of plantains.

source_sentence: 復懸種種紛葩繒綵，竪立種種雜色幢幡，真珠條貫，處處交橫，金鈴羅網，遍覆其上。
translation: Hanging a variety of silken fabric, he erects a variety of colorful banners and streamers with real beads running everywhere, and he fills them with a web of gold bells.

source_sentence: 復作日月星宿形像，張設空中，寶花流蘇，處處垂下，復以種種雜犛牛尾，所在間錯。
translation: It also created an image of the sun, moon, and stars that was spread out in the sky, with a fringe of precious flowers hanging down everywhere and a variety of yak tails placed between them.

source_sentence: 爾時，嚴餙迦毘羅處，猶如幻炎乾闥婆城，莊嚴是已，將羅睺羅，即入彼城，召喚釋種宗族傍親，悉皆聚集，廣辦種種財物飲食所須，調度方始，別更為羅睺羅作。
translation: At the time, the city of Kapilavastu was adorned like the illusory city of Gandhāra. After adorning it, he summoned Rāhula to enter the city, summoned all the relatives of the Śākya clan, gathered them together, prepared various goods and necessities for food, and then began to adjust and work separately for Rāhula.

source_sentence: 其生日耶輸陀羅生息之時，是羅睺羅阿脩羅王捉食其月，於剎那頃暫捉還放，是故釋種諸親族等，聚集議論，於羅睺羅食月之際一剎那間，生此童子，是故立名，名羅睺羅。
translation: On his birthday, when Yaśodharā was born and resting, King Rāhula-Asura had caught and eaten the moon and had temporarily caught and released it in a moment's time.

source_sentence: 其羅睺羅，可喜端正，諸人見者莫不歡悅，膚體黃白如真金色，然其頭頂猶如繖蓋，其鼻高隆猶如鸚鵡，兩臂修傭下垂過膝，一切支節無有缺減，諸根完具，莫不充備。
translation: His skin is yellow and white like true gold, but his head is like a parasol, his nose is high and bulging like a parrot, his arms are well built and hang down past his knees, there's nothing missing in any of his limbs, and his faculties are perfectly proportioned and full of everything.

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王為羅睺羅，置四嬭母。
translation: At the time, King Śuddhodana gave Rāhula four heads to mother.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一者抱持，二者洗濯，三者飲乳，四者遊戲。
translation: One will embrace, two will wash, three will drink milk, and four will play.

source_sentence: 此四嬭母，隨時將養，不久即令智慧備足。
translation: These four mothers of the world will nourish them at any time, and soon they'll have enough wisdom.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊在波羅[木*奈]轉大法輪，於時諸天各各相告，其聲展轉乃至梵頂。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was turning the great wheel of the Dharma in Bālā [munay], and the gods each told him that their voices extended to the top of Brahmā's head.

source_sentence: 即於彼時，輸頭檀王聞子悉達已得證於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，既覺證已，至波羅[木*奈]轉大法輪，為於天人而演說法。
translation: At the time, King Śuddhodana heard that his son Siddhârtha had realized unsurpassed, corrected, and accomplished enlightenment, went to Bālāta [Mokṣadāna], turned the great wheel of the Dharma, and delivered a sermon to the gods and humans.

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王於世尊所倍更憶念，作是思惟：「設何方便，令彼太子，愍諸眷屬速來至此迦毘羅城？」
translation: At the time, King Śuddhodana was doubly mindful of the Bhagavān and had this thought, "What method would cause that prince and his compassionate retinue to quickly come to this city of Kapilavastu?"

source_sentence: 復作是念：「應當遣誰而為使者？
translation: Again, he thought, "Who should I send as a messenger?

source_sentence: 誰有智略，能了此事？」
translation: Who has the wisdom to understand this matter?"

source_sentence: 復作是念：「此憂陀夷國師之子，次復車匿，此之二人，從小已來，恒共悉達，拊塵弄土，伴涉遨遊。
translation: Again, he thought, "These two people, the son of the teacher Śuddhâvāsa and the next one, have always traveled with Siddhârtha, poking around in the dust and dirt since they were children.

source_sentence: 此之二人，並各堪至悉達多所，我今當遣往彼為使。」
translation: Each of these two people is capable of reaching Siddhârtha, and I will now send them as my envoy."

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王喚優陀夷國師之子及以車匿，而告之言：「汝等二人，應當知時。
translation: It was then that King Śuddhodana summoned the son of Udāyin and Chandaka and told them, "You two should know the time.

source_sentence: 今者太子既得成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提已，至波羅[木*奈]國轉大法輪，為諸天人演說諸法。
translation: Now, after he has accomplished supreme perfect enlightenment, the prince will go to the country of [Mokṣala*Nāga] to turn the great wheel of the Dharma and explain the Dharma to the gods and humans.

source_sentence: 汝等今可速往至彼悉達多所，宣我告勅，傳我意旨：『今汝太子，行難苦行，至其邊際，稱遂汝心，已得證於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，已復轉於無上法輪。
translation: Now, you may quickly go to Siddhârtha there, proclaim my instructions, and convey my will, 'Now, you prince, after performing difficult and painful actions and reaching their limits, you have been praised for fulfilling your aspirations, realizing unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, and turning the unsurpassed wheel of the Dharma.'

source_sentence: 既為天人演說諸法，善哉太子！
translation: Since you've explained the teachings to gods and humans, good for you, Crown Prince!

source_sentence: 今可來詣迦毘羅城，為憐一切諸眷屬故。』」
translation: Now, you may come to Kapilavastu, for the pity of all your followers.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，優陀夷國師之子并及車匿，而白王言：「大王！
translation: At that point, the sons of Udayinī and Chandaka said to the king, "Great king!

source_sentence: 當知，悉達太子若不來者，未審我等更作何計？」
translation: You should know that if Prince Siddhârtha doesn't come, we haven't yet been asked what we're going to do."

source_sentence: 王報之言：「汝等但聽太子處分。」
translation: The king told them, "All of you must obey the prince's order."

source_sentence: 其優陀夷國師之子并及車匿，即白王言：「如大王勅，不敢違命。」
translation: The son of Udāyin and Chandaka then said to the king, "As the king has commanded, I dare not disobey."

source_sentence: 受王勅已，頂禮其足，各還本處，辭別父母諸眷屬等，漸行往至波羅[木*奈]國諸仙居處鹿野苑中。
translation: After receiving the king's order, they bowed their heads at his feet, returned to their original location, parted with their parents and retinues, and gradually traveled to the Deer Preserve of Bārā [munai].

source_sentence: 至彼處已，頂禮佛足，却住一面白言：「世尊！
translation: When he arrived there, he bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, withdrew to one side, and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等今者奉承大王輸頭檀勅遣來至此，而王告言：『善哉太子！
translation: We were sent here by King Śuddhodana's command, and the king told us, 'Good, Prince!

source_sentence: 汝今苦行已得超越，滿汝心願成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，轉大法輪，復為天人演說諸法。
translation: Now, you've transcended your austerities, fulfilled your heart's desire to achieve supreme perfect enlightenment, turned the great wheel of the Dharma, and again explained the Dharma for gods and humans.

source_sentence: 善哉太子！
translation: Good for you, Prince!

source_sentence: 今可來至此迦毘羅婆蘇都城，憐愍一切諸眷屬故。』」
translation: Now, I can come to this capital city of Kapilavastu and have compassion on all my followers.'"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊聞此語已，故說偈言：「若人已調伏，　　世無不伏者，　諸佛境無邊，　　無跡無來去。
translation: After hearing this, the Bhagavān therefore spoke the verse, saying, "If a person is disciplined, there's no one in the world who isn't disciplined, the realm of the buddhas is limitless, and there's no trace of coming or going.

source_sentence: 若人不入網，　　愛無所從生，　諸佛境無邊，　　無跡無來去。」
translation: If a person doesn't enter a net, there's no desire that arises from it, and the realms of the buddhas are limitless, with no trace of coming or going."

source_sentence: 時優陀夷國師之子并及車匿白言：「世尊！
translation: The son of Udāyin and Chandaka then said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 欲令我等當何所作？」
translation: What do you want us to do?"

source_sentence: 佛告彼等作如是言：「汝能學我此諸弟子出家法不？」
translation: The Buddha addressed them and said, "Can you train these disciples of mine in the way of leaving home?"

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊雖問彼等，但彼二人，先於佛邊，已有慕仰出家之意，因白佛言：「我等並各願樂出家。」
translation: Although the Bhagavān asked them about it, those two people had already longed for renunciation at the Buddha's side, so they said to the Buddha, "We each wish to leave home."

source_sentence: 於時世尊即聽出家，與受具戒。
translation: The Bhagavān then agreed to allow them to leave home and receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊自從出家起坐，未曾面向生地迦毘羅城，乃至未化賢友知識五比丘等，及以長老耶輸陀等親善友輩，波羅捺城所生，有四大富長者諸勝男子。
translation: Since then, the Bhagavān had risen from his seat as a renunciant and had never faced the city of Kapilavastu, nor had he trained five monks who were good friends, nor had he trained a group of good friends like elder Yaśodhar, nor had he produced four wealthy elders who were excellent men in the city of Pārāṇasī.

source_sentence: 何等為四？
translation: What are the four?

source_sentence: 一毘摩羅、二蘇婆睺、三富樓那、四伽婆般帝。
translation: 1. Vimalakīrti, 2. Subāhu, 3. Pūrṇa, and 4. Gavāṃpati.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者耶輸陀，有善知識等五十餘人；長老富婁那彌多羅尼子，亦有徒眾三十一人；長老摩訶迦旃延，復有八萬四千徒眾；長老娑毘耶，亦有勝徒，合三十人，同行善友其數六十；復有迷祇耶聚落所生，長老那毘迦栖那耶那。
translation: At the time, Venerable Yaśodhar had more than fifty good friends and so forth; the elder Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra also had thirty-one disciples; the elder Mahākātyāyana also had eighty-four thousand disciples; the elder Sābhīya also had thirty excellent disciples who traveled with him and had sixty good companions; and there was also the elder Nābhī-Kāśinagara born in the colony of Mahākāyana.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有一婆羅門，其有二女：一名難陀，二名婆羅。
translation: At the time, there was another Brāhmaṇa who had two daughters, one named Nandha and the other named Bhalā.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有一婆羅門，名曰提婆，并及其妻。
translation: Then, there was another Brāhmaṇa named Deva and his wife.

source_sentence: 長老頻蠡迦葉，合有五百螺髻梵志。
translation: The elder Vṛhatkāśyapa had five hundred conch-tufted priests with him.

source_sentence: 復有長老那提迦葉螺髻梵志，其數三百。
translation: Then there was the elder Nadī-Kāśyapa, a conch-tufted priest, numbering 300.

source_sentence: 復有長老伽耶迦葉，諸徒眾等，其數二百，亦是螺髻諸梵志等。
translation: Then there was Elder Gayā-Kāśyapa and his disciples, numbering 200, who were also conch-tufted priests.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有長老憂波斯那，數合二百五十人俱。
translation: At the time, there was also the elder Ṛupāsna, who was numbered 250 in number.

source_sentence: 爾時，復有一樹林中五百苦行諸仙人等，為雨法雨。
translation: At the time, there was another grove of five hundred ascetics and sages who were raining down the Dharma.

source_sentence: 王舍城中，頻婆娑羅王及臣等，凡九十二那由他人。
translation: In the city of Rājagṛha, King Bimbisāra and his ministers numbered ninety-two nayutas.

source_sentence: 長老摩訶迦葉，長老舍利弗、目揵連等，又刪闍耶波梨婆闍迦外道弟子，五百人等。
translation: There were five hundred elders, including Mahākāśyapa, elders Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, and lay disciples of Jayaprajāpājaka.

source_sentence: 化如是輩若干人已，然後世尊方始廻面向本生地迦毘羅城。
translation: After teaching these groups of people, the Bhagavān then began to face the city of Kapilavastu, where he had originally been born.

source_sentence: 時，優陀夷見婆伽婆廻面坐向本所生地迦毘羅城，又復諸天告彼長老優陀夷言：「善哉尊者！
translation: When Udayinī saw Bhagavān sitting facing back toward the city of Kapilavastu, the gods again addressed the elder Udayinī, saying, "Good, venerable!

source_sentence: 今可請佛願至生地本迦毘羅婆蘇都城，為其憐愍諸眷屬故。」
translation: Now, may I ask the Buddha to vow to visit the native Kapilavastu city in the native land for the sake of his compassion for his retinue?"

source_sentence: 爾時，長老優陀夷善知聖意如來將去，遂從坐起，偏袒右臂，整理衣服，合掌向佛，僂身低頭，而說偈言：「譬如非時諸樹木，　　欲著花果待其時，　非時花果無光麗，　　尊今可渡恒伽河。
translation: Knowing well that the Tathāgata of Noble Intent was about to depart, Udayinagara rose from his seat, bared his right arm, adjusted his robes, put his palms together, bowed his head to the Buddha, and spoke in verse, saying, "It's like a tree that waits for the right time to produce flowers and fruit when it wants to, or a fruit that lacks radiance at an inopportune time, so now your Holiness can cross the Gaṅgā River.

source_sentence: 樹木紛葩花正開，　　其花香遍十方剎，　花既開敷結果實，　　尊向生地正是時。
translation: The trees are in full bloom, and their flowers smell like the fragrance of buddhas in ten directions.

source_sentence: 此時最妙最為勝，　　清流香潔泉池水，　百鳥林中出妙響，　　諸欣悅事是其時。
translation: This is the most wonderful and outstanding time, when clear streams scent the clean spring-fed water, and a hundred birds make a wonderful noise in the forest, making all sorts of happy things happen.

source_sentence: 釋種往昔心發願，　　一切大地我獨攝，　見尊出家大憂怖，　　不稱心願甚欝怏。
translation: In the past, the Śākya lineage had the resolve to vow that I alone would contain all the great grounds, and I was greatly distressed to see the venerable leave home and discontented with his vow.

source_sentence: 世尊眷屬所思遲，　　由尊生子羅睺羅，　願往至彼為決疑，　　大眾渴仰思欲見。
translation: The Bhagavān's retinue is longing for Rāhula, the son born from the Bhagavān, to go there to resolve their doubts, and the great multitude longingly desires to see him.

source_sentence: 如來念母養育恩，　　為彼慈心憐愍故，　若見遠來大聖師，　　應得歡喜除憂惱。
translation: Because the Tathāgata is mindful of his mother's kindness in nurturing him and has compassion for her, if he sees a great sage teacher from afar, he'll rejoice and remove his grief.

source_sentence: 釋種大王輸頭檀，　　往昔起此微妙願，　何當得見金色體，　　我子入此迦毘城。
translation: The great Śākyamuni King Śuddhodana made this subtle vow in the past, so how could he have seen his golden body when my son entered this city of Kapilavastu?

source_sentence: 此時非熱亦非寒，　　堪稱世尊受樂道，　億數釋種瞻仰待，　　猶如畢宿冀月迴。」
translation: At that point, it's neither hot nor cold, the Bhagavān is worthy of the pleasant path, and the hundreds of millions of seeds of the Śākyas look up to him like Pīlusu waiting for the moon to return."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即告長老優陀夷言：「汝優陀夷！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the elder Udāyin, "You, Udāyin!

source_sentence: 若其然者，汝等二人，於先可至彼迦毘羅婆蘇都城，告我親眷諸釋種等，作如是言：『今者太子，苦行已徹，愍汝等故，不久欲來。』」
translation: If that's the case, then you two could go to that city of Kapilavastu and tell my retinue of Śākyamunis to say, 'Now, the prince has completed his ascetic practices, and he's going to come soon out of pity for you.'"

source_sentence: 其優陀夷及彼車匿，蒙佛勅已，而白佛言：「唯然世尊！
translation: Udāyin and Chandaka, having been commanded by the Buddha, said to him, "Yes, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我不敢違。」
translation: I dare not disobey."

source_sentence: 頂禮佛足，右遶三匝，辭退而去，次第漸行至迦毘羅婆蘇都城尼俱陀林，依彼聚落，暫時止住。
translation: He bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, circled him three times to his right, withdrew, and gradually traveled in order to the Nigrodha Grove in Kapilavastu's capital city, where he relied on that village and stopped momentarily.

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王嚴駕駟馬寶車而出，往至彼園，占觀好地。
translation: At the time, King Śuddhodana drove out in a jeweled chariot with an arrow and horse, went to that park, and looked around at the beautiful grounds.

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王於時遙見長老車匿及優陀夷，剃除鬚髮，身著袈裟，手執鉢器，見已即告諸大臣言：「汝等大臣！
translation: King Śuddhodana then saw the elders Chandaka and Udāyin, shaved off their hair, wearing robes, and carrying bowls in their hands, and when he saw them, he addressed his ministers, saying, "You ministers!

source_sentence: 此何人也？
translation: Who is this person?

source_sentence: 剃除鬚髮，身著色衣，手持應器。」
translation: He shaved off his hair, put on colorful clothing, and carried a portable container."

source_sentence: 時大臣等即報王言：「此等二人，乃是悉達太子門徒。」
translation: The ministers then reported to the king, "These two men are disciples of Prince Siddhârtha."

source_sentence: 爾時，輸頭檀王，心懷懊惱，悵怏不樂，而作是言：「我子端正，容儀可喜，觀者無厭，喻如金像，而彼身形，今如是也。」
translation: At the time, King Śuddhodana was distressed and discontented, and he said, "My son is correct, has pleasing features, and his appearance is unfailingly described as a golden image, whereas his body is now thus shaped."

source_sentence: 不憙觀見，謂諸臣言：「汝等必當斷是二人，勿令我見。」
translation: Not being proud of this view, he said to his ministers, "You must stop these two people so that I won't see them."

source_sentence: 作是語已，始往園內。
translation: After he said that, he went inside the garden.

source_sentence: 爾時臣等作如是念：「今此二人，一者乃是國師之子，二者悉達太子侍者。」
translation: The ministers then had this thought, "Now, one of these two people is the son of the national teacher, and the other is Prince Siddhârtha's attendant."

source_sentence: 作是籌量，不能遣却。
translation: After this assessment, they couldn't get rid of them.

source_sentence: 輸頭檀王在園遊觀，還欲出時，爾時，諸臣恐王見彼長老二人生煩惱故，遂將安置空牆院內。
translation: When King Shourdan was touring the park and was about to leave, the ministers were afraid that the king would be troubled by the sight of those two elders, so they placed them inside the empty courtyard.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊告諸比丘，作如是言：「汝等比丘！
translation: At that point, the Bhagavān addressed the monks and said, "You monks!

source_sentence: 今可速疾辦具衣鉢，我今欲行遊觀餘國城邑聚落，因欲向我本自生地彼迦毘羅婆蘇都城，憐愍一切諸眷屬故。」
translation: Now, I would like to travel to see the cities and towns of other countries because I want to go to the capital of Kapilavastu, where I was originally born, and have compassion on all my retinue."

source_sentence: 爾時，長老舍利弗從座而起，整理衣服，偏袒右肩右膝著地，合掌向佛，而作是言：「希有世尊！
translation: At that point, the elder Śāriputra rose from his seat, adjusted his robes, bared his right shoulder, knelt on his right knee, put his palms together, and addressed the Buddha, saying, "It's rare, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 未曾有也。
translation: "It's unprecedented.

source_sentence: 世尊今者行正是時，甚精甚妙，今者世尊！
translation: Now, Bhagavān, this is the right time to do it, and it's very fine and marvelous, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 乃欲遊觀諸餘國城，實是其時。」
translation: This is really the time when I want to travel to see the cities of other countries."

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告舍利弗言：「舍利弗！
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Śāriputra, saying, "Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 汝今欲得聞此事者，當為汝說。
translation: "Now, if you want to hear about this, I will explain it for you.

source_sentence: 尸棄如來、多陀阿伽多、阿羅訶、三藐三佛陀，將欲遊行本自生地處處觀看城邑聚落，其時微妙甚可愛樂因緣之事。」
translation: The Śikhin Tathāgata, the Tathāgata, the Ārāha, and the Samyak-saṃbuddha will want to travel to their own native land and visit cities and villages, which are then marvelous and very enjoyable causes and conditions."

source_sentence: 爾時，舍利弗白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Śāriputra said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 今正是時。
translation: Now is the right time.

source_sentence: 願為比丘演說往昔尸棄如來詣自生地遊觀國邑，令諸比丘聞佛說已，當如是持。」
translation: May you explain for the monks how the Tathāgata Śikhin visited his native land and traveled around the country in the past, so that after hearing the Buddha's teaching, the monks will thus maintain it."

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊即以偈說尸棄如來遊歷觀看本生地事：「善哉甚妙舍利弗，　　汝今應當一心聽，　昔日尸棄聖如來，　　往昔觀看生地事。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke in verse about the Śikhin Tathāgata's travels to see his native land: "Good, wonderful Śāriputra, now you should listen with one mind as the Śikhin Tathāgata of yore watched the events of his native land in the past.

source_sentence: 所至一切村聚落，　　往見尸棄聖如來，　處處皆各生甘泉，　　八功德味悉具足。
translation: In all the villages and towns that he visited, he used to see the Śikhin Tathāgata, and everywhere he went, sweet springs were produced and the taste of the eight virtues was fully present.

source_sentence: 所至一切村聚落，　　往見尸棄大聖師，　處處皆有諸花樹，　　枝葉垂下普蓊欝。
translation: In all the villages and towns that he visited, he went to see the Śikhin Tathāgata, the great sage teacher, and everywhere he went there were flowering trees with their branches and leaves dropping down in great profusion.

source_sentence: 所至一切林樹下，　　尸棄如來止住處，　是樹自然雨妙花，　　遍布其地悉充滿。
translation: Where he goes, underneath all the trees of the forest where the Tathāgata Śikhin stops, the trees naturally rain down marvelous flowers, and the ground is completely filled with them.

source_sentence: 所經一切林樹下，　　尸棄如來若止住，　其樹甘果自然落，　　枝條婀娜悉低垂。
translation: Whenever he passes under a forest tree, if the Śikhin Tathāgata stops, the sweet fruit of that tree naturally falls, and its graceful branches all hang low.

source_sentence: 有樹人所攀及者，　　花果紛雜甚可憐，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: If there were trees that people could reach, the flowers and fruits would be so mixed that it would be pitiful, and the Tathāgata Śikhin would be a great sage teacher who would cause such things to flourish.

source_sentence: 若有人所不及樹，　　妙花甘果自然落，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: If there's a tree that someone doesn't reach, the marvelous flowers and sweet fruit fall naturally, and Śikhin Tathāgata, the great sage teacher, should be made to feel and spread such a thing.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨大妙花姜迦羅，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in the sky and it rains down the great marvelous flowering gandharva, the Śikhin Tathāgata, the great sage teacher, should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　普雨清涼妙花雨，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in the sky, they rain down a rain of cool, wonderful flowers, and the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher is moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨花名曰曼陀羅，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space, it rains flowers named maṇḍalas, and the Śikhin Tathāgata, the great sage teacher, should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨花名曰波梨耶，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: "The gods are in space, and it rains flowers named pārijā, which the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should cause to flourish as such.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨花名曰毘婆伽，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: "The gods are in space, and it rains flowers named vibhāga, the great sage teacher of the Śikhin Tathāgata, which should cause such things to flourish.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨花名曰香勝香，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: "The gods are in space, and it rains flowers named fragrant incense, which the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should cause to flourish like this.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨諸種種妙香花，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in the sky, they rain flowers with various wonderful fragrances, and the Śikhin Tathāgata, the great sage teacher, should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨花名曰普至香，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space, they rain flowers named Puṣyaprabha, and the Śikhin Tathāgata, the great sage teacher, is caused to disseminate such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨於異種妙香花，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space and it rains flowers with a different kind of wonderful fragrance, the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　純雨真金妙色花，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space and it rains pure flowers of genuine gold and marvelous color, the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨諸七寶妙色花，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space and it rains flowers of marvelous color made of the seven treasures, the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨花純是真金莖，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: "When the gods are in space and it rains flowers with pure stalks of real gold, the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　純雨一切寶莖花，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: "When the gods are in space and it rains flowers that are pure and have stems of gold, the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　純雨優波羅花葉，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in the sky and it rains down pure leaves of the upalakṣa flower, the great sage teacher Śikhin Tathāgata should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　純雨栴檀妙香末，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space and it's raining fine fragrant powder of sandalwood, the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　雨赤栴檀妙末香，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space and it rains the wonderful fragrance of red sandalwood, the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　純雨牛頭栴檀末，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space and it rains down pure powder of ox-head sandalwood, the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 諸天在於虛空裏，　　奏作種種天樂音，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When the gods are in space and make various sounds of heavenly music, the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 非人在於虛空裏，　　拂弄種種妙天衣，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: When non-humans are in space, they are flicking various kinds of wonderful celestial robes, and the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be made to disseminate such things.

source_sentence: 諸天隨順佛行路，　　持諸種種妙香花，　其花紛雜種種光，　　雨諸道路深至膝，　彼時無寒復無熱，　　亦無蚊虻諸惡蟲，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: The gods follow the Buddha's path, carrying various kinds of wonderfully fragrant flowers, which are filled with various kinds of light, and rain down paths as deep as their knees, when it's neither cold nor hot and there are no mosquitoes or stinging insects, which should cause the Śikhin Tathāgata, the great sage teacher, to disseminate such things.

source_sentence: 一切大地悉微動，　　并大巨海及諸山，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: All the earth is finely shaken, and there's a huge ocean and mountains, so the Śikhin Tathāgata's great noble teacher should cause such things to flourish.

source_sentence: 一切大地普調柔，　　清淨無有惡荊棘，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: All the earth is completely pliant, pure, and without harsh thorns, and the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be moved to produce such things.

source_sentence: 所有丘墟悉平滿，　　山陵堆阜皆坦然，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　應感流行如是事。
translation: All the hills and mounds are level and full, and the mountains and hills are smooth, so the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher should be inspired to popularize such things.

source_sentence: 剎利種姓大威德，　　其數八萬有六千，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: There are 80,000 to 6,000 bhadra families of great authority, and the Śikhin Tathāgata's great noble teacher follows them as they walk, stand, sit, and rise.

source_sentence: 諸婆羅門淨行種，　　其數八萬有六千，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: There are 80,000 to 6,000 Brahman families of pure practice, and the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher follows them as they walk, stand, sit, and rise.

source_sentence: 豪富威德大長者，　　其數八萬有六千，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: There are 80,000 to 6,000 wealthy, authoritative, and powerful elders, including the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher, who follow him as he walks, stands, sits, and rises up.

source_sentence: 亦有地居諸天等，　　皆是妙色淨莊嚴，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: There are also earth-dwelling gods and so forth, all of them beautifully colored and purely adorned, that the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher follows as he walks, stands, sits, and rises.

source_sentence: 復有虛空諸天眾，　　皆大威德最嚴勝，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: "Again, there are the gods of the sky, all of them of great majesty and supreme virtue, and Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher follows them as they walk, stand, sit, and rise.

source_sentence: 四大天王及天眾，　　殊勝妙色威德者，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: The four great celestial kings and gods, all of them of marvelous appearance and authoritative power, are followed by the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher as he walks, stands, sits, and rises.

source_sentence: 護世四天大王等，　　復有殊妙大威勢，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: The four guardian gods and other great kings of the heavens also have marvelous, great authority, and the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher follows them as they walk, stand, sit, and rise.

source_sentence: 忉利三十三天眾，　　微妙威力轉殊勝，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: The Trāyastriṃśa gods are filled with people of marvelous power, and the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher follows them as they walk, stand, sit, and rise.

source_sentence: 須彌山頂帝釋王，　　及諸親友眷屬等，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: King Indra of Sumeru, his friends, retinues, and others, the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher follows him as he walks, stands, sits, and rises up.

source_sentence: 善分耶摩諸天輩，　　妙色清淨大威嚴，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: The good part of the Yamântaka celestials, with their wonderfully pure and great majesty, is the Śikhin Tathāgata's great noble teacher, who follows him as he walks, stands, sits, and rises up.

source_sentence: 喜樂諸天兜率陀，　　威嚴功德甚微妙，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: Delighting in the gods of Tuṣita, whose dignity and virtue are so subtle, Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher follows them as they walk, stand, sit, and rise.

source_sentence: 次復化樂諸天等，　　所行功德轉微妙，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: "Furthermore, they are delighted by the gods and goddesses, whose activities and attributes are ever-so-subtle, and they are followed by the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher as he walks, stands, sits, and rises.

source_sentence: 他化自在諸天等，　　威德光嚴甚輝耀，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: The gods and goddesses who are freely partaking of the pleasures of the transformation of others have such radiant and brilliant qualities that the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher follows them as they walk, stand, sit, and rise.

source_sentence: 大梵宮中諸天輩，　　妙色威力轉光華，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: Those gods in the palace of Brahmā, whose marvelous form and authoritative power produces a radiant appearance, are followed by the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher as he walks, stands, sits, and rises.

source_sentence: 色界所有諸天輩，　　及諸龍神金翅鳥，　乾闥婆等阿修羅，　　夜叉鬼神及羅剎，　緊那羅等摩睺羅，　　皆得具足妙威嚴，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: All the celestials of the form realm, dragons, gods, gold-winged birds, asuras like Gandharvas, yakṣas, ghosts, rājas, and mahoras like Kiṃnaras are endowed with marvelous dignity, and the Śikhin Tathāgata's great sage teacher follows them as they walk, stand, sit, and rise.

source_sentence: 世間有諸眾生類，　　已說及以不說者，　尸棄如來大聖師，　　行住坐起相隨逐。
translation: There are all sentient beings in the world who have spoken and those who haven't spoken, but Śikhin Tathāgata's great noble teacher follows them as they walk, stand, sit, and rise.

source_sentence: 彼尊尸棄如是行，　　調伏無量天人眾，　正覺入於大涅槃，　　永斷諸有及後生。」
translation: Thus does that Bhagavān Śikhin conduct himself in such a way as to tame measureless gods and humans, and he correctly awakens and enters the great nirvāṇa, which permanently ends all existence and later birth."

source_sentence: 時，佛復告舍利弗言：「汝舍利弗！
translation: The Buddha then again addressed Śāriputra, saying, "You, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 尸棄如來、應供、正遍知、明行足、善逝、世間解、無上士、調御丈夫、天人師、佛、世尊，初欲往到本自生地，有如是等無量微妙希有行事。」
translation: When Śikhin Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Omniscient, Perfect in Conduct, Well Gone, Understander of the World, Unsurpassed Person, Trainer, Teacher of Gods and People, Buddha, or World Honored One first wishes to go to the place of his own birth, there are such measureless, subtle, and rare things as these."

source_sentence: 佛本行集經卷第五十一
translation: Sutra on the Collection of the Past Activities of the Buddha, Volume 51
